sponsor.partnerMessage: September is Hunger Action Month, and NWA Daily is launching a campaign to support hunger awareness in NWA. For every new subscriber NWA Daily gets in the month of Sept., we will donate $1 to the NWA Food Bank. Make a difference in your community by sharing THIS LINK with your network.

posts.title: Group Project
posts.content:
The Arkansas Department of Transportation is constantly improving the way we get around here in Northwest Arkansas with construction projects dedicated to safe and efficient travel. 

  • The people's hwy: ArDOT has proposed a few options for the alignment of the hwy that would connect the Bella Vista Bypass to the U.S. Hwy 412 bypass west of I-49. The dept. is seeking feedback to know what makes the most sense for the people who will be driving on the connecting hwy. 
  • Online info: Virtual meetings will be held through Sept. 20 for those who wish to attend. The project presentation with four alternatives for the new hwy are online along with exhibits and materials. 

For a full write up on the story, click HERE.

posts.title: Diverse & Inclusive
posts.content:
After the success of a film festival, the next logical step is to create a production company. 

  • Steps in film: The BFFoundation was formed last year to host the Bentonville Film Festival this past August. The foundation’s new production company is called Bentonville Way Entertainment, its purpose being the same as the festival —to champion women, diverse and inclusive voices in filmmaking. 
  • Already moving: The aim of BWE is to produce in Arkansas whenever possible and provide resources to local productions always. BWE already has films in the pipeline that feature Bentonville festival alumni. Three films are currently in preproduction, expected to go into production late this year and early next. 

Click HERE for more. 

Story courtesy of DEADLINE*

posts.title: Sounds Like Light
posts.content:
The unification of sound, color and life are difficult to understand, yet Crystal Bridges’ North Forest Lights beautifully expresses the interconnectivity.

  • Forest life: North Forest Lights is open today, Sept. 1, through Jan. 2, 2022 for a third season. There are 5 installations in the wood around the museum which animate the “soul of the forest” with music and lights. 
  • Night walks: The experience is accessible to people of all ages, so plan to take a walk with family and friends after sunset on a Wednesday through Sunday night for an immersive nature-inspired adventure. Tickets are available online. Walk-up tickets will cost extra.

Learn more, HERE.

posts.title: Charity Ball
posts.content:
Whether you’re good at pickleball or tennis or not, it doesn’t really matter. You can help raise money for the NWA Women’s Shelter by registering to play Sept. 18. 

  • Sports for charity: The NWA Challenge for Hope is in its 30th year of raising money for charity. This year’s fundraisers are a golf tournament, which took place on Monday, and a pickleball and tennis tournament on Sept. 18 at the Pinnacle Country Club. 
  • Pro clinic: Get together with a team and attend a clinic with the pros on Sept. 17 to prepare you for the big day. Registration will include the clinic on the 17th, merchandise, lunch & dinner on the 18th, and a dance party to end the event. 

Click HERE for details.

posts.title: Bullseye
posts.topic: Sponsored by The Peel Compton Foundation
posts.content:
Alright Robin Hoods and Katniss Everdeens, it’s your time to shine at the new archery range in Bentonville. 

  • Bows and arrows: The Quiver Archery Range in Osage Park is set to open Wed, Sept. 29. There will be opportunity to do archery by the hour, participate in individual programs, or be a member with a starting cost of $100/yr .
  • Pro or no pro: Whether you just want the basics, or you dream of being a certified archer, The Quiver has a program for you. It will be open 11a-5p and is located at 1701 SE F St. in Bentonville.

Check out programs and memberships HERE.

pick.content:
• Champs: Get on the course and volunteer at the Walmart NW Arkansas Championship. Registration is open for multiple committees.*
  • Got turkey? We might be eating quail this Thanksgiving due to the decline in turkey production.
  • Cash money: Fayetteville is offering cash incentives for people to get vaccinated.
  • Cartography: Check out these super cool interactive maps of the Fayetteville.
  • Pamper yourself: Here's a new guide to luxury hotels in NWA.
  • Ninjas in our midst: One of our very own is competing in the American Ninja Warrior finals.
  • Megaphone: Advertise with us to tell the region about your event, company, or story!
